<FR>These things have I spoken unto you, that ye should not be offended.<Fr><RF>offended: scandalized or, made to stumble<Rf>
<FR>They shall put you out of the synagogues: yea, the time cometh, that whosoever killeth you will think that he doeth God service.<Fr>
<FR>And these things will they do unto you, because they have not known the Father, nor me.<Fr>
<FR>But these things have I told you, that when the time shall come, ye may remember that I told you of them. And these things I said not unto you at the beginning, because I was with you.<Fr>
<FR>But now I go my way to him that sent me; and none of you asketh me, Whither goest thou?<Fr>
<FR>But because I have said these things unto you, sorrow hath filled your heart.<Fr><CM>
<FR>Nevertheless I tell you the truth; It is expedient for you that I go away: for if I go not away, the Comforter will not come unto you; but if I depart, I will send him unto you.<Fr>
<FR>And when he is come, he will reprove the world of sin, and of righteousness, and of judgment:<Fr><RF>reprove: or, convince<Rf>
<FR>Of sin, because they believe not on me;<Fr>
<FR>Of righteousness, because I go to my Father, and ye see me no more;<Fr>
<FR>Of judgment, because the prince of this world is judged.<Fr>
<FR>I have yet many things to say unto you, but ye cannot bear them now.<Fr>

<FR>Howbeit when he, the Spirit of truth, is come, he will guide you into all truth: for he shall not speak of himself; but whatsoever he shall hear, <FI>that<Fi> shall he speak: and he will shew you things to come.<Fr>
<FR>He shall glorify me: for he shall receive of mine, and shall shew <FI>it<Fi> unto you.<Fr>
<FR>All things that the Father hath are mine: therefore said I, that he shall take of mine, and shall shew <FI>it<Fi> unto you.<Fr><CM>
<FR>A little while, and ye shall not see me: and again, a little while, and ye shall see me, because I go to the Father.<Fr>

Then said <FI>some<Fi> of his disciples among themselves, What is this that he saith unto us, <FR>A little while, and ye shall not see me: and again, a little while, and ye shall see me: and, Because I go to the Father?<Fr>
They said therefore, What is this that he saith, <FR>A little while?<Fr> we cannot tell what he saith.

Now Jesus knew that they were desirous to ask him, and said unto them, <FR>Do ye enquire among yourselves of that I said, A little while, and ye shall not see me: and again, a little while, and ye shall see me?<Fr>
<FR>Verily, verily, I say unto you, That ye shall weep and lament, but the world shall rejoice: and ye shall be sorrowful, but your sorrow shall be turned into joy.<Fr>

<FR>A woman when she is in travail hath sorrow, because her hour is come: but as soon as she is delivered of the child, she remembereth no more the anguish, for joy that a man is born into the world.<Fr>
<FR>And ye now therefore have sorrow: but I will see you again, and your heart shall rejoice, and your joy no man taketh from you.<Fr><CM>
<FR>And in that day ye shall ask me nothing. Verily, verily, I say unto you, Whatsoever ye shall ask the Father in my name, he will give <FI>it<Fi> you.<Fr>
<FR>Hitherto have ye asked nothing in my name: ask, and ye shall receive, that your joy may be full.<Fr>

<FR>These things have I spoken unto you in proverbs: but the time cometh, when I shall no more speak unto you in proverbs, but I shall shew you plainly of the Father.<Fr><RF>proverbs: or, parables<Rf>
<FR>At that day ye shall ask in my name: and I say not unto you, that I will pray the Father for you:<Fr>
<FR>For the Father himself loveth you, because ye have loved me, and have believed that I came out from God.<Fr><CM>
<FR>I came forth from the Father, and am come into the world: again, I leave the world, and go to the Father.<Fr>
His disciples said unto him, Lo, now speakest thou plainly, and speakest no proverb.<RF>proverb: or, parable<Rf>
Now are we sure that thou knowest all things, and needest not that any man should ask thee: by this we believe that thou camest forth from God.
Jesus answered them, <FR>Do ye now believe?<Fr>

<FR>Behold, the hour cometh, yea, is now come, that ye shall be scattered, every man to his own, and shall leave me alone: and yet I am not alone, because the Father is with me.<Fr><RF>his own: or, his own home<Rf>
<FR>These things I have spoken unto you, that in me ye might have peace. In the world ye shall have tribulation: but be of good cheer; I have overcome the world.<Fr><CM>
